text: The Palace of the Shirvanshahs is the biggest monument of the Shirvan-Absheron branch of Azerbaijan architecture. It is in the Inner City of Baku. There is the main building of the palace, Divanhane, the burial vaults, the shah's mosque with a minaret, Seyid Yahya Bakuvi's mausoleum, a portal in the east - Murad's gate, a reservoir and the remnants of the bath-house. The palace is shown on the front of the Azerbaijani 10,000 manat banknote of 1994-2006.Central Bank of Azerbaijan . National currency: 10000 manat . – Retrieved on 25 February 2010. It is also on the new 10 manat banknote.Central Bank of Azerbaijan . National currency: 10 manat . – Retrieved on 25 February 2010. ==References== Category:Palaces in Asia Category:Buildings and structures in Baku Category:15th-century buildings and structures Category:Azerbaijani culture Category:World Heritage Sites in Azerbaijan Category:Archaeological sites in Azerbaijan Category:Tourist attractions in Azerbaijan
title: Palace of the Shirvanshahs
